subs.text: @gaminginthewild For problems like this (too many good things to choose from, too little time), I put things in a list and let a random picker make the choice for me. It was my attempt to combat decision fatigue, plus remove regret from the equation.
subs.rawText: @gaminginthewild For problems like this (too many good things to choose from, too little time), I put things in a list and let a random picker make the choice for me. It was my attempt to combat decision fatigue, plus remove regret from the equation.

subs.text: I bought this since I’d be sitting in that level anyway, and going alone anyway, and my seat is randomly assigned, which I can get behind because it means I don’t have to decide on where to sit (I hate deciding anything). [link]

subs.text: @PortmanDoe I wish there was a gesture for “You’ve had two years to figure this out” that’s subtle enough for that person to not come over and punch me in the face, but I don’t think there is.

subs.text: March 22

@geerlingguy It’s a service to log (“scrobble”) and list the music one plays. That is, if I play a song, the fact that I played a song shows up on my profile. It’s probably someone who watched your videos using Chrome. There’s an extension that “detects” music played on YT and “scrobbles” it.
subs.rawText: @geerlingguy It’s a service to log (“scrobble”) and list the music one plays. That is, if I play a song, the fact that I played a song shows up on my profile. It’s probably someone who watched your videos using Chrome. There’s an extension that “detects” music played on YT and “scrobbles” it.

subs.text:
@Kimli Oh, that’s a great amount of time to spend there. I’m not much of a car driver, but having access to one on my last trip there was essential.

Have you heard the it’s-funny-because-it’s-true joke that you should be prepared for three types of weather at all times?
subs.rawText:
@Kimli Oh, that’s a great amount of time to spend there. I’m not much of a car driver, but having access to one on my last trip there was essential.

Have you heard the it’s-funny-because-it’s-true joke that you should be prepared for three types of weather at all times?

subs.text:
@Kimli I’d love to hear about the trip during and afterwards. I assume you’ll do what I joke are the legally required tourist things, like tour the Golden Circle and go to the Blue Lagoon? Iceland’s tourist authorities will demand proof you’ve done those things.

OK, no they won’t.
subs.rawText:
@Kimli I’d love to hear about the trip during and afterwards. I assume you’ll do what I joke are the legally required tourist things, like tour the Golden Circle and go to the Blue Lagoon? Iceland’s tourist authorities will demand proof you’ve done those things.

OK, no they won’t.

subs.text: Now that almost all of the COVID-19 restrictions have been lifted in Ontario, never to return, since the pandemic is over, I still only have weak explanations about the strong reactions against them.
subs.rawText: Now that almost all of the COVID-19 restrictions have been lifted in Ontario, never to return, since the pandemic is over, I still only have weak explanations about the strong reactions against them.

subs.text: The weak explanation I had about the “stop living in fear, live your life!” people was that they themselves lacked a fear response to basically anything. But that’s a brain disorder, and a rare one.
subs.rawText: The weak explanation I had about the “stop living in fear, live your life!” people was that they themselves lacked a fear response to basically anything. But that’s a brain disorder, and a rare one.

subs.text: The weak explanation I had about the people who complained that they couldn’t go to a restaurant or attend a party was that these were ecstatic experiences and that preventing them from having those experiences amounted to torture. But is dining out or partying that awesome?
subs.rawText: The weak explanation I had about the people who complained that they couldn’t go to a restaurant or attend a party was that these were ecstatic experiences and that preventing them from having those experiences amounted to torture. But is dining out or partying that awesome?

subs.text: The weak explanation I had for people who protested against COVID-19 restrictions was that they didn’t actually believe in anything other than getting on TV. Going viral online was acceptable, with getting on the TV news being the ultimate goal for them. But was it?
subs.rawText: The weak explanation I had for people who protested against COVID-19 restrictions was that they didn’t actually believe in anything other than getting on TV. Going viral online was acceptable, with getting on the TV news being the ultimate goal for them. But was it?

subs.text: I went to the grocery store tonight. Not a lot of people there, which is normal just before closing. A noticeable few not wearing a mask, including an employee. No giant sign at the escalator anymore. I thought maybe there’s be one recommending the wearing of masks, but nope.
subs.rawText: I went to the grocery store tonight. Not a lot of people there, which is normal just before closing. A noticeable few not wearing a mask, including an employee. No giant sign at the escalator anymore. I thought maybe there’s be one recommending the wearing of masks, but nope.

subs.text: My apartment building took down the mask requirement signs from the front door and next to the elevators. The COVID-19 pandemic is now truly over.
subs.rawText: My apartment building took down the mask requirement signs from the front door and next to the elevators. The COVID-19 pandemic is now truly over.

subs.text:
Now that the pandemic is over, I can start thinking about my pandemic regrets.

• I kept active, but regret not trying to get leaner and stronger.
• I somewhat regret not reading more books, but I had a hard time imagining people breathing on each other, even fictionally.
subs.rawText:
Now that the pandemic is over, I can start thinking about my pandemic regrets.

• I kept active, but regret not trying to get leaner and stronger.
• I somewhat regret not reading more books, but I had a hard time imagining people breathing on each other, even fictionally.

subs.text:
@BooksCassidy I only really changed my family name on Twitter (that said, it’s the name I was born with). It goes back to the one on my ID when I’m travelling. I use my “bowling name” in other contexts.

File this under: If I have to explain it, I’m probably embarrassed by it.

subs.text: March 18

I don’t look like anybody in my neighbourhood, don’t have a dog like seemingly everybody in my neighbourhood, don’t have a partner like seemingly everybody in my neighbourhood. I wonder if any of that’s true in Etobicoke.
subs.rawText: I don’t look like anybody in my neighbourhood, don’t have a dog like seemingly everybody in my neighbourhood, don’t have a partner like seemingly everybody in my neighbourhood. I wonder if any of that’s true in Etobicoke.

subs.rawText: Is it quiet in Etobicoke? It’s constantly loud in Downtown Toronto.

subs.text: I don’t listen to addresses by non-parliamentarians to Canada’s House of Commons much, so it’s jarring to hear the Speaker say the name of the MPs he calls on to make a speech.
subs.rawText: I don’t listen to addresses by non-parliamentarians to Canada’s House of Commons much, so it’s jarring to hear the Speaker say the name of the MPs he calls on to make a speech.

subs.text: The Speaker of the UK House of Commons does it as a normal part of business, but it usually only happens in Canada if an MP is expelled from the chamber.
subs.rawText: The Speaker of the UK House of Commons does it as a normal part of business, but it usually only happens in Canada if an MP is expelled from the chamber.

subs.text: I don’t think Twitter should give up on the feature, just that it’s not an excellent default. An algorithmic timeline with people and topics you follow co-mingled is interesting. [link]

subs.text: Is showing Likes in the timeline weird? A little. But TweetDeck calls that the “Activity” feed, so it’s a thing that’s existed for a long time.

subs.text: I’m having a pretty good day so far.
subs.rawText: I’m having a pretty good day so far.

subs.text: My day continues to go pretty well.
subs.rawText: My day continues to go pretty well.

subs.text: Today’s been a pretty good day, too.
subs.rawText: Today’s been a pretty good day, too.

subs.text: I got more or less what I wanted out of today.
subs.rawText: I got more or less what I wanted out of today.

subs.text: Yesterday was pretty good. Today is starting off well.
subs.rawText: Yesterday was pretty good. Today is starting off well.

subs.text: Today was indeed pretty darn good.
subs.rawText: Today was indeed pretty darn good.

subs.text: The weather put a damper on things, but otherwise I had a good day today.
subs.rawText: The weather put a damper on things, but otherwise I had a good day today.

subs.text: I did everything I set out to do today, so I’d consider that a good day.
subs.rawText: I did everything I set out to do today, so I’d consider that a good day.

subs.text: Yesterday was pretty good. I got a good amount of sunlight, and got done what needed to get done.
subs.rawText: Yesterday was pretty good. I got a good amount of sunlight, and got done what needed to get done.

subs.text: Today was busy at work, and a productive meeting at one of my non-profits, and it was otherwise filled with music, so therefore it was a good day.
subs.rawText: Today was busy at work, and a productive meeting at one of my non-profits, and it was otherwise filled with music, so therefore it was a good day.

subs.text: Another good day, filled with snow and new music and a movie about a red panda.
subs.rawText: Another good day, filled with snow and new music and a movie about a red panda.

subs.text: Today was a good day, I suppose.
subs.rawText: Today was a good day, I suppose.

subs.text: It was better than most of the Saturdays I’ve had in the last couple of years.
subs.rawText: It was better than most of the Saturdays I’ve had in the last couple of years.

subs.text: I went for a run, talked to a friend, made curry chicken & fried rice, talked to my dad, and ran the dishwasher twice (if you know what I mean), so today definitely qualifies as a good day.
subs.rawText: I went for a run, talked to a friend, made curry chicken & fried rice, talked to my dad, and ran the dishwasher twice (if you know what I mean), so today definitely qualifies as a good day.

subs.text: I read a book, got some DVDs in the mail, and cooked tacos, so I’d consider today a good day.
subs.rawText: I read a book, got some DVDs in the mail, and cooked tacos, so I’d consider today a good day.

subs.text: I read a book, only ate meals that I cooked, and went for a run. That counts as a good day.
subs.rawText: I read a book, only ate meals that I cooked, and went for a run. That counts as a good day.

subs.text: I couldn’t help a neighbour fix her printer, but today was otherwise a good day (seeing as how she gave me cookies and beer for my time).
subs.rawText: I couldn’t help a neighbour fix her printer, but today was otherwise a good day (seeing as how she gave me cookies and beer for my time).

subs.text: Being busy and productive at work plus the warm weather and a walk to the library to pick up a book made for a good day.
subs.rawText: Being busy and productive at work plus the warm weather and a walk to the library to pick up a book made for a good day.

subs.text: I did everything I set out to do today, so it was a good day, but I don’t know what to do with the rest of my evening.
subs.rawText: I did everything I set out to do today, so it was a good day, but I don’t know what to do with the rest of my evening.

subs.text: Today started off good (a run and a workout followed by a diner breakfast) and went downhill (waiting 3 hours for something that didn’t happen) then back uphill (movie night with co-workers), so it was ultimately a good day.
subs.rawText: Today started off good (a run and a workout followed by a diner breakfast) and went downhill (waiting 3 hours for something that didn’t happen) then back uphill (movie night with co-workers), so it was ultimately a good day.

subs.text: Today was full of missteps (including a literal misstep, crushing a child’s glasses), but I got to see people I admire again, I took 14,000 steps without having to try for 10,000, and I was among a happy crowd, so I consider today a good day.
subs.rawText: Today was full of missteps (including a literal misstep, crushing a child’s glasses), but I got to see people I admire again, I took 14,000 steps without having to try for 10,000, and I was among a happy crowd, so I consider today a good day.

subs.text: I ate lunch in the park next to my apartment today. That alone made it a good day.
subs.rawText: I ate lunch in the park next to my apartment today. That alone made it a good day.

subs.text: Yesterday I ate a burrito, so it was therefore a good day, if maybe it was otherwise uneventful. Today I cooked miso chicken, and felt a bit more on top of things at work (than usual, at least).
subs.rawText: Yesterday I ate a burrito, so it was therefore a good day, if maybe it was otherwise uneventful. Today I cooked miso chicken, and felt a bit more on top of things at work (than usual, at least).

subs.text: March 1
@nmebrown This game is my aesthetic.
subs.rawText: @nmebrown This game is my aesthetic.

subs.text: We set a world record! Here’s the recap of the operation I participated in to create a 14-level homogenous field over Toronto. #Ingress [link]
subs.rawText: We set a world record! Here’s the recap of the operation I participated in to create a 14-level homogenous field over Toronto. #Ingress https://t.co/bEERIozXz9

subs.text: My photo of the treacherous icy path I took to visit a portal during the operation made the cut. It was truly unanticipated (it wasn’t like that in my reconnaissance the week prior), and where I ended up was perilous, too. I caught myself worrying that be left for dead. [link]
subs.rawText: My photo of the treacherous icy path I took to visit a portal during the operation made the cut. It was truly unanticipated (it wasn’t like that in my reconnaissance the week prior), and where I ended up was perilous, too. I caught myself worrying that be left for dead. https://t.co/PX7YZ5Lpoh

subs.text: I find it really funny, on multiple levels, that the author of the post recapping the record-setting homogenous field highlighted me deploying a resonator at the portal named The Ministry of Silly Walks while at the bar for celebratory drinks. #Ingress [link]
subs.rawText: I find it really funny, on multiple levels, that the author of the post recapping the record-setting homogenous field highlighted me deploying a resonator at the portal named The Ministry of Silly Walks while at the bar for celebratory drinks. #Ingress https://t.co/Fwb4fG9nSb

subs.text: Is there a Wikipedia page for sanctions against Russia by businesses? I found one for states, but not *Hank Hill shudder* non-state actors. [link]

subs.text: @toddsieling Rats, they deleted it. I was waiting until I could get a frosty beverage to watch the video, but I missed my chance.

subs.text: @NewsBlur This is pretty close to my dream mode in NewsBlur. Is there a setting where I can see the full entry for every item in Magazine view? I have a big monitor, and would like to see all of the content right away.
